title: 103_hr367
content: SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. The "Social Security Trust Fund Amendments of 1993" Act establishes a Board of Trustees for the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund, composed of government officials and public members nominated by the President. The Board of Trustees for the Social Security Trust Funds is composed of government officials and public members nominated by the President. The Secretary of the Treasury serves as the Managing Trustee, and the Commissioner of Social Security serves as Secretary of the Board. The Board meets at least ten times a year and is responsible for holding the Trust Funds and reporting to Congress annually on their operation and status. The Board of Trustees for the Social Security Trust Funds reports annually to Congress on the operation and status of the funds, recommends improvements in administrative procedures, reviews general policies, approves fund investments, and ensures actions are in the beneficiaries' best interest. The Managing Trustee is responsible for investing Trust Funds not needed for current withdrawals, following guidelines to benefit beneficiaries, minimize risks, and comply with investment provisions. The Managing Trustee invests Trust Funds not immediately needed, with restrictions on investments in interest-bearing US obligations. Public-debt obligations can be issued for purchase by the Trust Funds, with fixed maturities and interest rates based on market yields. The Managing Trustee, with Board approval, invests Trust Funds not needed for current withdrawals in interest-bearing US obligations or guaranteed securities. Other investments include bonds, debentures, and securities as per section (c).
